font families.back:
Serif - proportional and have serifs
serifs are the decorations on the ends of the storkes
Sans-Serif - proportional and do not have serifs
Monospace - not proportional
Cursive - attempt to emulate human handwriting
Fancy - non really defined by any single characteristic
other than our inability to classify them
into the other font families

using generic font families.back:
body { font-family: sans-serif;}
h1,h2,h3,h4 { font-family: serif; }

specifying a Font Family.back:
h1 { font-family: TimesNR, serif; }
h2 { font-family: 'New Century Schoolbook', Times, serif; }

font size and inheritance.back:
computed values are inherited in CSS not percentages

percentages are cumulative

font-style.back:
p { font-style: normal; }
em { font-style: italic; }

font.back:
h1 {font: italic 900 small-caps 30px Verdana, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;}
h2 {font: bold normal italic 24px Verdana, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;}
